summary: Stephen has a soft, fragile heart, but he is very good at hiding it, and even better at guarding it. (not sure if this is just a...
question: Stephen has a soft, fragile heart, but he is very good at hiding it, and even better at guarding it. (not sure if this is just a thought, a headcannon, or a prompt, but I couldn't resist)
answer:
Please, don’t ever resist! I can’t even find the words to tell you how much I love this. When I got this message I just grinned at it like an idiot and thought: YES! A thousand times yes! Whatever it is, it’s lovely and it inspired this little thing. I hope it meets your approval, dear Anon. 💞

(Yes, I had to put in little spoon Stephen. I just adore the thought of Stephen held in an secure embrace by Tony.)

Worlds Apart (Searching For You)

(AO3)

“Hey, Stephen! What are you doing tonight?”

Tony’s cheerful tone grated on his nerves and he snapped back without thinking. “Bathing in the blood of my vanquished foes, if you must know.”

There was a moment of silence on the other end of the line that lasted just long enough for Stephen to replay Tony’s words in his mind. Fuck. He closed his eyes and bit his lip, unsure how to proceed. “Tony,” he started but was immediately drowned out.

“Sounds exciting. Do you need some help with that? Acquiring the liquid, filling the bath, assisting the Sorcerer Supreme out of his ceremonial robes and into the fragrant bath of choice? You can tell me, I can be there in about ten minutes to be your own personal bath slave. No torture or coercion required.”

summary: A Stark Is Born *Prequel to That’s Stark’s Boy*
title: A Stark Is Born *Prequel to That’s Stark’s Boy*
body:
Summary: Peter listens to the story about how your parents met and the story of why you stopped contact with Tony.

Grace Hart is an up and coming Agent to the FBI, although mostly on desk duty due to not following instructions, she’s on a mission to protect the most sort after man. Tony Stark, recently taking over his dad’s company, Stark makes it difficult for Grace to keep him safe. A story about how true love, but how loving each other is easier when they aren’t together.

Pairings: Tony Stark x Grace Hart (Miss Congeniality OC!) & Peter Parker x Male!Reader & Tony Stark x Pepper Potts

Warnings: Swear words, violence and drinking. It’s Angst, but fluff too. Sex is mentioned, obviously. But I’m not writing smut for this.

Word Count: 2745

Authors Note: Sandra Bullock is in no way how YOU should picture the mom. She’s simply an OC I created, the mom is a mixture of a bunch of Sandra Bullock characters, and I’m using the actress as INSPIRATION. You do NOT have to picture her as Sandy B, but she is an OC and therefore I will be using the name Grace for her, you’re free to place another name for the mother. It’s the same with all my fics, I leave it open to interpretation. I only use gifs as inspo and decoration, they’re not meant to depict how the reader/ the mother should look like.

Chapter Two/ Six

Grace knew this job would be difficult having to take orders from a billionaire, especially when she could be out actually trying to get the guy, instead, she got babysitting duty. By all means, it should be easier but it isn’t. It’s like Tony wants to be killed or something, he’s always attending parties late and bringing home strangers (mostly women). If Tony gets killed whilst she’s on the job, she’ll get fired, Grace knows that because it’s her duty to protect this man.

The schedule given to her is hardly his actual day, he spends most of it down in his work-lab, that she isn’t allowed in or he goes out- requesting she does all the work Pepper usually does. It’s like looking after a child, a child that thinks he’s in charge and can do as he pleases, but yet has responsibilities that he refuses to acknowledge. All it took was two days, two days for Grace to flip.

“Get up.” Grace sternly tells the sleeping Stark, he groans as she commands Jarvis to open his black-out blinds, “you’re not having me attend YOUR meetings for you, you have to go to them and I’ll come along with you.”

Tony sits up and rubs his eyes, scowling at the woman before him. Dressed in a lilac blazer, matching pencil skirt and arms crossed. The look reminded Tony one of which his mother used to wear, it made a chill shoot up his spine. A small part of him didn’t believe she was a simple PA, from her steely glare and her eyes always scanning her surroundings. It’s like she was looking for some form of trouble, always on guard and, usually, PA’s don’t have a ‘fuck off’ attitude. They’re meant to be welcoming and always happy to help and do, yet Grace is different.

Tony thought better to argue with the woman, deciding to get out of bed and dressed. Grace averted her eyes away as he searched for clothes, throwing on some band tee and jeans. Running his fingers through his hair quickly, turning to Grace with a smirk.

“You’re attending a meeting for a multi-million dollar business,” Grace began, “and you’re attending in a band-tee?” Grace sighed when Tony only shrugged, grabbing a dark navy blazer and throwing that on over it. “well, hurry up and find some shoes, we’re going to be late.”  

Grace walks out of Tony’s bedroom and releases a long sigh, she isn’t scared of him but telling a billionaire what to do or even being stern with him… felt slightly terrifying. She didn’t want to push her luck and have him fire her, then how is she meant to protect him? 24hr surveillance outside his house? She’s done that before and it killed her back having to sleep in the back of a car.

Tony exits his room, with a grumpy frown, she would’ve told him to have a shower but they didn’t have enough time, but he still reeked of whatever alcohol he was inducing the night before. The smell of sweat, booze and perfume lingered on his skin, it was a little hard to breathe around him. Grace pulled out a pocket-sized perfume spray, spritzing it on him as they walked to the car.

“Will you stop that?” Tony harshly slapped her hand away making her almost drop the perfume.

“Well if you were a responsible human I wouldn’t be having to spray you just to make you smell, somewhat, lovely.” Grace snaps back, “thank you, Happy.” She kindly smiles at the man she had gotten a little closer with.

Turns out, Tony would rather drive himself places - when he’s sober, at least- Happy often drives behind Tony being his security detail, they have a close relationship, almost sibling-like. Happy is the only person Grace has come across that has anything nice to say about Stark, apart from the obvious brown-nosers, the people that want something from Tony, Happy seems to really know him and still attests to the fact Tony is a good man.

The drive is long and silent, “So… what is this meeting about?” Grace asked, eyeing Tony from the side and toying with her hands in her lap.

“Just Stark Industries stuff, future of the company and so forth, you know, we’re making weapons for the government so it’s best to keep on top of legal stuff,” Tony explained and Grace nodded along. “I’m CEO it’s good for me to attend these things, I prefer the little events we do, the testers and reveals of the latest weapons.”

Grace chuckled slightly, “CEO, really?” Tony only nodded his head, “but you’re only thirty.”

He simply shrugs, “Please, don’t remind me.” Grace held her hands up in defence, “That’s what happens when you inherit a company, I was only twenty when my parents died. I wasn’t old enough to run the company, so Obadiah Stane was CEO till I turned twenty-one. He’s been friends of my family for years, he mostly attends the meetings and does all this boring stuff.”  

“Must’ve been difficult for him to hand over the company back to you,” Tony frowned and looked at Grace, who only shrugged, “I’m just saying being CEO of a company, only for some twenty-one-year-old know-it-all take over. Think I’d go insane,” Grace joked and snorted loudly before calming down.

They both walked inside the Stark Industries building, Tony nodding ‘hello’ at a few employees. Grace hung a little behind, feeling a tad out of place. A big part of her praying that she’ll get a phone call saying they caught the guy, that she can stop and go back to her normal desk and be an Agent again.

“Tony?” A deep voice carries across the building, “I didn’t expect for you to turn up.”

Tony shakes the taller man’s hand, a smile on both of their faces. “Yeah, well my temporary personal assistant insisted I attended today.”

Grace gives a little wave, Stane only nods in her direction before putting an arm around Tony’s shoulders and walking him towards the meeting room. In a deep conversation about the company and other things that Grace doesn’t care about, her eyes scan the room of the faces. Anyone of these people could be working for whoever wants to take Stark down, she’d have to remember to get the team to look into every Stark employee.

It’d be quicker to ask JARVIS but she didn’t want to raise alarm bells to Tony, despite the technology being at her fingertips, she had to be smart about this. Listen to instruction and just keep Tony safe, no searching or prying for the person; priority is Anthony Stark.

“Oh, she can wait out here. Usually, you don’t attend, since you’re here, no one has to take notes.” Stane smiles and leads Tony into the room, shutting it on Grace’s face.

She scowled at the door for a moment before turning and sitting on a chair, crossing her legs and huffing loudly. She pulled the skirt down a little, grumbling under her breath. She’s used to pant-suits, not skirts and dresses- thankfully, she hasn’t had to wear a dress, yet. Whoever Miss Potts is, she’s a saint, that’s for sure. Having to deal with Tony all day, every day: it’s hard work. Honestly, she couldn’t wait to go back and just do desk duty again.

“How are you holding up?” Happy’s voice breaks her out of her mind, she sighs heavily and crosses her arms causing Happy to chuckle. “It’s not so bad working for him, you’ll get used to it.”

Grace scoffs, “I hope I never have to, I just can’t wait to go back to being an Agent again.” Graces eyes scan over everyone again, “have you done background checks on everyone that works here?” Happy nods, “do you have any ideas on who could be doing this?”

Happy shakes his head, “The list of enemies for a Stark is… long, believe it or not. Being a billionaire kinds puts a bullseye on your back.”

“What about that Stane guy?” Happy scoffs loudly, leaning against the wall with his arms crossed. “I get a weird vibe from him, especially since he used to be CEO then Tony took over. Imagine putting your life’s work into something, only for the bosses son to get all the glory.  Plus in the short while, Tony has been CEO here, he’s really made this place flourish. That type of-”

Happy shakes his head, “It’s not Stane. He’s been friends with Howard for years, he’s really helped Tony steer this company and lead him. He’s the last person that would want Tony dead.”

Grace could only nod at what Happy said, yet a gut feeling told her to look into the man. She couldn’t rule anyone out till she checked herself, even though technically it isn’t her job to do so, part of looking out for Tony was making sure the people he had close were safe. Despite not wanting this job, she’s going to take it seriously and that means going all in.

It was half an hour later that Tony finally exited the meeting, a group of men all in suits all following behind. Laughing at some joke that must’ve been told, Grace instantly stands and begins to follow the crowd of men. The loud chatter of business and pleasure being apparent, Grace rolled her eyes and followed silently.

“It was nice to see your face in a meeting for once,” Stane chuckled as Tony walked up the car, “I have your assistant here to thank.” He extends a hand to Grace, she smiles tightly and shakes his hand, almost instantly letting go when she could. “Look after this guy, he’s a little wild but don’t let him push you around.”

Grace nodded, “I’ll be sure to.”

They all get into the car in silence, Happy driving Tony home in silence. Grace sits staring out of the window, her mind preoccupied with a million thoughts.

“Hey, Happy, can you drop me off at the Burger King coming up?” He gives a little nod, “I’m gonna need a burger and fries to make it through today.” She mutters mostly to her self, ignoring Tony who is staring at her.

Tony can survive an hour without her, he’s going home with Happy, who she trusts will, and has been, looking after him. The car pulls into the carpark and Grace gets out, smiling when she sees it’s hardly packed inside. Before she can walk she hears two more car doors open, Tony stepping out along with Happy. Tony doesn’t say anything only starts walking towards the food place, Grace quickly catches up and Happy follows behind.

“I haven’t been to one of these since college,” Tony muses and Grace raises an eyebrow. She mostly gets take-out or some form of fast food; late nights at work often meant easy food. Tony steps up, the server looking a tad shocked over Stark ordering food, “What do you want Happy?”

Happy squints as he looks at the menu but instantly says, “I’ll have a Whopper meal, extra large and a diet coke.”

Tony nods, “I imagine that’s a good choice, I’ll have the same.” He then turns his attention to Grace, who just shrugs and gets the same. The server passes three large cups, Tony grabs one of the cups and walks over to the machine and places it under the diet coke one.

“Wow,” Grace amuses, “surprised you remembered how one of these works.”

“You know, contrary to popular belief, I am not that far removed from society.” Tony grabs a straw and begins to sip, watching as Grace adds ice cubes to her own drink.

Grace gave a disgruntled look, “No. But you only attended a private boarding school in Europe, where they have ‘house mothers’, not that far removed at all.”

Tony raised an eyebrow, “So, you’ve read up on me. I can’t help the fact my dad wanted me gone for the duration of the year.”

Grace was about to apologise but Happy came over with two trays of food, a big smile on his face. Leading the two of them to a nearby booth, where they sat and started to tear into their food. It’s silent as they eat, a few people taking photos of Tony in Burger King, probably, a little shook up over the fact he’s even dining here.

“So, Grace tell me about yourself,” Tony speaks up and looks at her with raised eyebrows, curiosity in his eyes that she hadn’t seen before.

Grace glances at Happy for a second, “Well, I grew up a tough neighbourhood. I have two older brothers, I don’t see much of them because working - it’s difficult to find off time, you know? My parents divorced when I was seventeen, I haven’t seen my dad since and my mum died when I was nineteen.”

Tony nods slowly, biting into a fry, “What do you do in your spare time?”

Grace chuckles and raises an eyebrow at Tony, who simply smiles and shrugs. “I do nothing, I have no hobbies or interests. Seriously, I’m a workaholic and I don’t have any friends outside of work because it’s hard to keep them when you have no time for anyone.” It falls silent again, “what about you? You must have more friends than just Happy and Pepper.”

“James Rhodes met him back in college and we have this brotherly-rivalry that has lasted up to now,” Tony smiles and Grace nods, “good guy, you’d like him actually. He’s very… responsible and always tries to make me take life seriously.”

Grace frowns, “You should take life a little more seriously, Tony.” He only rolls his eyes in response, “You work and social life, you should take that stuff seriously. It’s gonna come to a point where you’re not gonna know what’s going on in your business, and you’re CEO.”

It goes back to being silent again, only it’s mutual silence that is sometimes broken by Happy commenting on something. You finish the meal and head back to Tony’s where he goes straight to his workshop, Grace wouldn’t see him for a couple hours now. Deciding to get to work on “emails”, mostly any intel they found on Stane.

**Two days later**

Five days of looking after Stark and it was surprisingly getting easier. Although he still went out and partied a lot, it was much easier to figure out his whereabouts with the tracker she placed in all his shoes. Every move he made, she knew about it.

“What do you mean there’s nothing?” Grace snapped down the line to Matthews, who had left his vacation early to be in on the mission. “His assailant is still out there and I’m just one person, Matthews. If anything happens to him…”

Matthews chuckles down the line, “Sounds like you care about this guy.” Grace sighed, rolling her dark eyes, “Do you know if he’s been sent any more threats?” Grace sighs a ‘no’ down the phone, “seems they’ve gone silent, probably, planning their next move since the helicopter stunt didn’t work. Keep your eye out, Grace. You’re not the only one looking out for him, by the way. Colonel Rhodes made us put more men on security detail, they follow his every move too.”

Grace let out a sigh of relief, “Good. Just… keep me updated on everything, got it?”

“You bet, don’t get him killed, Hart.” The call ends and Grace sighs heavily.

“Who was that?” Grace jumps and swiftly turns to face Tony, “on the phone? Who was that? You looked pissed off.”

“Just a friend, he’s having trouble at work, like I could help him or something.” Grace snorts with her laugh, high-fiving herself for thinking fast for that lie.

Tony only nods and chuckles, “Okay. Well, tomorrow you’ll be meeting me and Happy for shopping, I’ve got this Gala thing and I have to attend. I need help on suits, you good at that type of stuff?”

Grace raised her eyebrows at Tony, he never normally asks for her opinion… on anything. Maybe these past couples of days, spending most of the day together has meant she’s earnt his trust and approval. He’d normally leave her and have Happy go with him, Happy promising her to keep her updated on everything that’s happening.

“Uh-sure, I know a bit.” Tony nodded with a half smile, before walking back inside his house.

(The first part can be viewed over on my blog, just scroll down a little bit and you’ll find it or can be found on my That’s Stark’s Boy masterlist. Let me know what you think about this, thank you - Rosalie)

Warnings: Swear words, violence and drinking. It’s Angst, but fluff too. Sex is mentioned, obviously. But I’m not writing smut for this.

Word Count: 2745

Authors Note: Sandra Bullock is in no way how YOU should picture the mom. She’s simply an OC I created, the mom is a mixture of a bunch of Sandra Bullock characters, and I’m using the actress as INSPIRATION. You do NOT have to picture her as Sandy B, but she is an OC and therefore I will be using the name Grace for her, you’re free to place another name for the mother. It’s the same with all my fics, I leave it open to interpretation. I only use gifs as inspo and decoration, they’re not meant to depict how the reader/ the mother should look like.

Chapter Two/ Six

Grace knew this job would be difficult having to take orders from a billionaire, especially when she could be out actually trying to get the guy, instead, she got babysitting duty. By all means, it should be easier but it isn’t. It’s like Tony wants to be killed or something, he’s always attending parties late and bringing home strangers (mostly women). If Tony gets killed whilst she’s on the job, she’ll get fired, Grace knows that because it’s her duty to protect this man.

The schedule given to her is hardly his actual day, he spends most of it down in his work-lab, that she isn’t allowed in or he goes out- requesting she does all the work Pepper usually does. It’s like looking after a child, a child that thinks he’s in charge and can do as he pleases, but yet has responsibilities that he refuses to acknowledge. All it took was two days, two days for Grace to flip.

“Get up.” Grace sternly tells the sleeping Stark, he groans as she commands Jarvis to open his black-out blinds, “you’re not having me attend YOUR meetings for you, you have to go to them and I’ll come along with you.”

Tony sits up and rubs his eyes, scowling at the woman before him. Dressed in a lilac blazer, matching pencil skirt and arms crossed. The look reminded Tony one of which his mother used to wear, it made a chill shoot up his spine. A small part of him didn’t believe she was a simple PA, from her steely glare and her eyes always scanning her surroundings. It’s like she was looking for some form of trouble, always on guard and, usually, PA’s don’t have a ‘fuck off’ attitude. They’re meant to be welcoming and always happy to help and do, yet Grace is different.

Tony thought better to argue with the woman, deciding to get out of bed and dressed. Grace averted her eyes away as he searched for clothes, throwing on some band tee and jeans. Running his fingers through his hair quickly, turning to Grace with a smirk.

“You’re attending a meeting for a multi-million dollar business,” Grace began, “and you’re attending in a band-tee?” Grace sighed when Tony only shrugged, grabbing a dark navy blazer and throwing that on over it. “well, hurry up and find some shoes, we’re going to be late.”  

Grace walks out of Tony’s bedroom and releases a long sigh, she isn’t scared of him but telling a billionaire what to do or even being stern with him… felt slightly terrifying. She didn’t want to push her luck and have him fire her, then how is she meant to protect him? 24hr surveillance outside his house? She’s done that before and it killed her back having to sleep in the back of a car.

Tony exits his room, with a grumpy frown, she would’ve told him to have a shower but they didn’t have enough time, but he still reeked of whatever alcohol he was inducing the night before. The smell of sweat, booze and perfume lingered on his skin, it was a little hard to breathe around him. Grace pulled out a pocket-sized perfume spray, spritzing it on him as they walked to the car.

“Will you stop that?” Tony harshly slapped her hand away making her almost drop the perfume.

“Well if you were a responsible human I wouldn’t be having to spray you just to make you smell, somewhat, lovely.” Grace snaps back, “thank you, Happy.” She kindly smiles at the man she had gotten a little closer with.

Turns out, Tony would rather drive himself places - when he’s sober, at least- Happy often drives behind Tony being his security detail, they have a close relationship, almost sibling-like. Happy is the only person Grace has come across that has anything nice to say about Stark, apart from the obvious brown-nosers, the people that want something from Tony, Happy seems to really know him and still attests to the fact Tony is a good man.

The drive is long and silent, “So… what is this meeting about?” Grace asked, eyeing Tony from the side and toying with her hands in her lap.

“Just Stark Industries stuff, future of the company and so forth, you know, we’re making weapons for the government so it’s best to keep on top of legal stuff,” Tony explained and Grace nodded along. “I’m CEO it’s good for me to attend these things, I prefer the little events we do, the testers and reveals of the latest weapons.”

Grace chuckled slightly, “CEO, really?” Tony only nodded his head, “but you’re only thirty.”

He simply shrugs, “Please, don’t remind me.” Grace held her hands up in defence, “That’s what happens when you inherit a company, I was only twenty when my parents died. I wasn’t old enough to run the company, so Obadiah Stane was CEO till I turned twenty-one. He’s been friends of my family for years, he mostly attends the meetings and does all this boring stuff.”  

“Must’ve been difficult for him to hand over the company back to you,” Tony frowned and looked at Grace, who only shrugged, “I’m just saying being CEO of a company, only for some twenty-one-year-old know-it-all take over. Think I’d go insane,” Grace joked and snorted loudly before calming down.

They both walked inside the Stark Industries building, Tony nodding ‘hello’ at a few employees. Grace hung a little behind, feeling a tad out of place. A big part of her praying that she’ll get a phone call saying they caught the guy, that she can stop and go back to her normal desk and be an Agent again.

“Tony?” A deep voice carries across the building, “I didn’t expect for you to turn up.”

Tony shakes the taller man’s hand, a smile on both of their faces. “Yeah, well my temporary personal assistant insisted I attended today.”

Grace gives a little wave, Stane only nods in her direction before putting an arm around Tony’s shoulders and walking him towards the meeting room. In a deep conversation about the company and other things that Grace doesn’t care about, her eyes scan the room of the faces. Anyone of these people could be working for whoever wants to take Stark down, she’d have to remember to get the team to look into every Stark employee.

It’d be quicker to ask JARVIS but she didn’t want to raise alarm bells to Tony, despite the technology being at her fingertips, she had to be smart about this. Listen to instruction and just keep Tony safe, no searching or prying for the person; priority is Anthony Stark.

“Oh, she can wait out here. Usually, you don’t attend, since you’re here, no one has to take notes.” Stane smiles and leads Tony into the room, shutting it on Grace’s face.

She scowled at the door for a moment before turning and sitting on a chair, crossing her legs and huffing loudly. She pulled the skirt down a little, grumbling under her breath. She’s used to pant-suits, not skirts and dresses- thankfully, she hasn’t had to wear a dress, yet. Whoever Miss Potts is, she’s a saint, that’s for sure. Having to deal with Tony all day, every day: it’s hard work. Honestly, she couldn’t wait to go back and just do desk duty again.

“How are you holding up?” Happy’s voice breaks her out of her mind, she sighs heavily and crosses her arms causing Happy to chuckle. “It’s not so bad working for him, you’ll get used to it.”

Grace scoffs, “I hope I never have to, I just can’t wait to go back to being an Agent again.” Graces eyes scan over everyone again, “have you done background checks on everyone that works here?” Happy nods, “do you have any ideas on who could be doing this?”

Happy shakes his head, “The list of enemies for a Stark is… long, believe it or not. Being a billionaire kinds puts a bullseye on your back.”

“What about that Stane guy?” Happy scoffs loudly, leaning against the wall with his arms crossed. “I get a weird vibe from him, especially since he used to be CEO then Tony took over. Imagine putting your life’s work into something, only for the bosses son to get all the glory.  Plus in the short while, Tony has been CEO here, he’s really made this place flourish. That type of-”

Happy shakes his head, “It’s not Stane. He’s been friends with Howard for years, he’s really helped Tony steer this company and lead him. He’s the last person that would want Tony dead.”

Grace could only nod at what Happy said, yet a gut feeling told her to look into the man. She couldn’t rule anyone out till she checked herself, even though technically it isn’t her job to do so, part of looking out for Tony was making sure the people he had close were safe. Despite not wanting this job, she’s going to take it seriously and that means going all in.

It was half an hour later that Tony finally exited the meeting, a group of men all in suits all following behind. Laughing at some joke that must’ve been told, Grace instantly stands and begins to follow the crowd of men. The loud chatter of business and pleasure being apparent, Grace rolled her eyes and followed silently.

“It was nice to see your face in a meeting for once,” Stane chuckled as Tony walked up the car, “I have your assistant here to thank.” He extends a hand to Grace, she smiles tightly and shakes his hand, almost instantly letting go when she could. “Look after this guy, he’s a little wild but don’t let him push you around.”

Grace nodded, “I’ll be sure to.”

They all get into the car in silence, Happy driving Tony home in silence. Grace sits staring out of the window, her mind preoccupied with a million thoughts.

“Hey, Happy, can you drop me off at the Burger King coming up?” He gives a little nod, “I’m gonna need a burger and fries to make it through today.” She mutters mostly to her self, ignoring Tony who is staring at her.

Tony can survive an hour without her, he’s going home with Happy, who she trusts will, and has been, looking after him. The car pulls into the carpark and Grace gets out, smiling when she sees it’s hardly packed inside. Before she can walk she hears two more car doors open, Tony stepping out along with Happy. Tony doesn’t say anything only starts walking towards the food place, Grace quickly catches up and Happy follows behind.

“I haven’t been to one of these since college,” Tony muses and Grace raises an eyebrow. She mostly gets take-out or some form of fast food; late nights at work often meant easy food. Tony steps up, the server looking a tad shocked over Stark ordering food, “What do you want Happy?”

Happy squints as he looks at the menu but instantly says, “I’ll have a Whopper meal, extra large and a diet coke.”

Tony nods, “I imagine that’s a good choice, I’ll have the same.” He then turns his attention to Grace, who just shrugs and gets the same. The server passes three large cups, Tony grabs one of the cups and walks over to the machine and places it under the diet coke one.

“Wow,” Grace amuses, “surprised you remembered how one of these works.”

“You know, contrary to popular belief, I am not that far removed from society.” Tony grabs a straw and begins to sip, watching as Grace adds ice cubes to her own drink.

Grace gave a disgruntled look, “No. But you only attended a private boarding school in Europe, where they have ‘house mothers’, not that far removed at all.”

Tony raised an eyebrow, “So, you’ve read up on me. I can’t help the fact my dad wanted me gone for the duration of the year.”

Grace was about to apologise but Happy came over with two trays of food, a big smile on his face. Leading the two of them to a nearby booth, where they sat and started to tear into their food. It’s silent as they eat, a few people taking photos of Tony in Burger King, probably, a little shook up over the fact he’s even dining here.

“So, Grace tell me about yourself,” Tony speaks up and looks at her with raised eyebrows, curiosity in his eyes that she hadn’t seen before.

Grace glances at Happy for a second, “Well, I grew up a tough neighbourhood. I have two older brothers, I don’t see much of them because working - it’s difficult to find off time, you know? My parents divorced when I was seventeen, I haven’t seen my dad since and my mum died when I was nineteen.”

Tony nods slowly, biting into a fry, “What do you do in your spare time?”

Grace chuckles and raises an eyebrow at Tony, who simply smiles and shrugs. “I do nothing, I have no hobbies or interests. Seriously, I’m a workaholic and I don’t have any friends outside of work because it’s hard to keep them when you have no time for anyone.” It falls silent again, “what about you? You must have more friends than just Happy and Pepper.”

“James Rhodes met him back in college and we have this brotherly-rivalry that has lasted up to now,” Tony smiles and Grace nods, “good guy, you’d like him actually. He’s very… responsible and always tries to make me take life seriously.”

Grace frowns, “You should take life a little more seriously, Tony.” He only rolls his eyes in response, “You work and social life, you should take that stuff seriously. It’s gonna come to a point where you’re not gonna know what’s going on in your business, and you’re CEO.”

It goes back to being silent again, only it’s mutual silence that is sometimes broken by Happy commenting on something. You finish the meal and head back to Tony’s where he goes straight to his workshop, Grace wouldn’t see him for a couple hours now. Deciding to get to work on “emails”, mostly any intel they found on Stane.

**Two days later**

Five days of looking after Stark and it was surprisingly getting easier. Although he still went out and partied a lot, it was much easier to figure out his whereabouts with the tracker she placed in all his shoes. Every move he made, she knew about it.

“What do you mean there’s nothing?” Grace snapped down the line to Matthews, who had left his vacation early to be in on the mission. “His assailant is still out there and I’m just one person, Matthews. If anything happens to him…”

Matthews chuckles down the line, “Sounds like you care about this guy.” Grace sighed, rolling her dark eyes, “Do you know if he’s been sent any more threats?” Grace sighs a ‘no’ down the phone, “seems they’ve gone silent, probably, planning their next move since the helicopter stunt didn’t work. Keep your eye out, Grace. You’re not the only one looking out for him, by the way. Colonel Rhodes made us put more men on security detail, they follow his every move too.”

Grace let out a sigh of relief, “Good. Just… keep me updated on everything, got it?”

“You bet, don’t get him killed, Hart.” The call ends and Grace sighs heavily.

“Who was that?” Grace jumps and swiftly turns to face Tony, “on the phone? Who was that? You looked pissed off.”

“Just a friend, he’s having trouble at work, like I could help him or something.” Grace snorts with her laugh, high-fiving herself for thinking fast for that lie.

Tony only nods and chuckles, “Okay. Well, tomorrow you’ll be meeting me and Happy for shopping, I’ve got this Gala thing and I have to attend. I need help on suits, you good at that type of stuff?”

Grace raised her eyebrows at Tony, he never normally asks for her opinion… on anything. Maybe these past couples of days, spending most of the day together has meant she’s earnt his trust and approval. He’d normally leave her and have Happy go with him, Happy promising her to keep her updated on everything that’s happening.

“Uh-sure, I know a bit.” Tony nodded with a half smile, before walking back inside his house.

(The first part can be viewed over on my blog, just scroll down a little bit and you’ll find it or can be found on my That’s Stark’s Boy masterlist. Let me know what you think about this, thank you - Rosalie)

“Who was that?” Grace jumps and swiftly turns to face Tony, “on the phone? Who was that? You looked pissed off.”

“Just a friend, he’s having trouble at work, like I could help him or something.” Grace snorts with her laugh, high-fiving herself for thinking fast for that lie.

Tony only nods and chuckles, “Okay. Well, tomorrow you’ll be meeting me and Happy for shopping, I’ve got this Gala thing and I have to attend. I need help on suits, you good at that type of stuff?”

Grace raised her eyebrows at Tony, he never normally asks for her opinion… on anything. Maybe these past couples of days, spending most of the day together has meant she’s earnt his trust and approval. He’d normally leave her and have Happy go with him, Happy promising her to keep her updated on everything that’s happening.

“Uh-sure, I know a bit.” Tony nodded with a half smile, before walking back inside his house.

(The first part can be viewed over on my blog, just scroll down a little bit and you’ll find it or can be found on my That’s Stark’s Boy masterlist. Let me know what you think about this, thank you - Rosalie)
